CatDescriptText: Dr. George Gerneth, M.D., Verona and Mr. Lorenzo Potts, hotel employee, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, June 17, 1961, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think that courses in race relations should be taught in the public schools?  If so, in what grade do you think they should be taught first?" Mr. George Gerneth's answer reads: "I definitely think that it's a good idea.  After all, when you have a problem, one way to solve it is to educate people to the different aspects of the problem so they can better understand.  This way, some equitable solution can be arrived at.  The courses should begin in high school, because I think that children under that age are too young to understand."
